segments.en: Then a mendicant went up to the Buddha …

segments.pli: “kathaṃ nu kho, bhante, jānato kathaṃ passato sakkāyadiṭṭhi pahīyatī”ti?
segments.en: “Sir, how does one know and see so that identity view is given up?”

segments.pli: “Cakkhuṃ kho, bhikkhu, dukkhato jānato passato sakkāyadiṭṭhi pahīyati.
segments.en: “Mendicant, knowing and seeing the eye, sights, eye consciousness, and eye contact as suffering, identity view is given up. …

segments.pli: Rūpe dukkhato jānato passato sakkāyadiṭṭhi pahīyati.
Cakkhuviññāṇaṃ dukkhato jānato passato sakkāyadiṭṭhi pahīyati.
Cakkhusamphassaṃ dukkhato jānato passato sakkāyadiṭṭhi pahīyati … pe …
yampidaṃ manosamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tampi dukkhato jānato passato sakkāyadiṭṭhi pahīyati.
segments.en: And also knowing and seeing the pleasant, painful, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by mind contact as suffering, identity view is given up.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhu, jānato evaṃ passato sakkāyadiṭṭhi pahīyatī”ti.
segments.en: This is how to know and see so that identity view is given up.”

sections.title: Then a mendicant went up to the Buddha ……

suttaplex.blurb: Identity view arises due to grasping the process of sense experience.
